qas.question: What were the large blockhouses called that the Germans developed?
Another name for the High Bunkers was what?
What was placed on the blockhouses by the Germans?
What city had some of the last buildings to fall in 1945?
What structure did the British build in the North Sea?

context: The Germans developed massive reinforced concrete blockhouses, some more than six stories high, which were known as <a0_0>Hochbunker "High Bunkers"<a0_0/> or <a1_0>"Flaktürme" flak towers<a1_0/>, on which they placed <a2_0>anti-aircraft artillery<a2_0/>. Those in cities attacked by the Allied land forces became fortresses. Several in <a3_0>Berlin<a3_0/> were some of the last buildings to fall to the Soviets during the Battle of Berlin in 1945. The British built structures such as the <a4_0>Maunsell Forts<a4_0/> in the North Sea, the Thames Estuary and other tidal areas upon which they based guns. After the war most were left to rot. Some were outside territorial waters, and had a second life in the 1960s as platforms for pirate radio stations.
